jobs_results.title: REMOTE Android Developer
jobs_results.description: An industry leading Fortune 500 client in the Home Services industry is looking for a new Android Mobile Application Developer to assist in customer-facing applications. This team is responsible for the migration of multiple assets into one platform -- these apps interface with IoT connected products and offer critical capabilities to customers. This new developer would join an existing team of 4-5 other developers and be responsible for hands-on development using Kotlin. They will be expected to collaborate with cross-functional partners and patriciate in the agile development processes including sprint planning, iterative development, estimations, and design sessions. This is the perfect role if you are interested in growing your Android Development skillset with an innovate and collaborative team.

jobs_results.title: Android Developer, Up to £45k - Manchester/Remote
jobs_results.description:
Android Developer, Up to £45k - Manchester/Remote

Exciting opportunity for a passionate Android Developer to join a very well-known brand in Manchester city centre to work on an array of applications with around 300k users.

Part of a wider group which employs over 2000 people worldwide, the Manchester hub is a core part of their technology offering and development.

In this role you’ll be working on existing apps to maintain, looking at ways to evolve them using new tech and looking at opportunities to build new greenfield products to put out to market.

Skills:
• Kotlin / Java
• REST / JSON
• Unit Testing / TDD / Jenkins / Docker
• Flutter (A bonus)

If you are someone with 1-2 years’ experience and looking for exposure and the chance to learn cutting edge technology in your space, then this would be good for you!

In return for your commitment to them, they are offering up to £45k salary with an attractive benefits package.

The split between office and home working is flexible; they have been mainly at home but would like to get people into the office as much as they can but aren’t limiting on the amount of days at this time.

Should this sound like something you are interested in and would like to find out more, please contact me directly on 07971 678 296 or apply via the advert and I will be in touch ASAP.

jobs_results.title: Ada Meher | Android Developer – Remote (must be UK based) – £55k
jobs_results.description: Android Developer – Remote (must be UK based) – £55k Fully remote | Kotlin / Jetpack Compose | Personal Development & Progression Plan | Flexible Hours | Evolving Digital Agency Ada Meher is currently working with a scaling digital agency as they look to recruit a Senior Android Developer to work on the development of a number of their exciting client projects. The successful applicant can expect to work on both greenfield development and BAU development project using Android and surrounding tech such as Kotlin & Jetpack Compose. This role would suit someone who is self-driven and ambitious enough to work independently as well as take advantage of the resources and expertise made available to them internally to aide their personal development. This is a real focus for the client and every member of staff has their own personal development plan and with this role there will be a clearly defined pathway into a Technical Lead role. Due to this self-started culture the business works with flexibility at its core and it happy to allow the team to work remotely, though you'll need to be based in the UK. They also offer flexibility in hours and holiday days, to ensure that employees are able to make the job work around their other life commitments. To Be Considered… Prior experience in Android Mobile App Development Experience working across multiple projects simultaneously in a fast paced environment Strong communication skills Experience with Kotlin, Jetpack Compose and PlayStore Experience with Rooms and Dependency Injection Experience with Unit Testing / TDD As mentioned, due to their commitment to continuous improvement, each employee in this business has a tailored personal development plan to help inspire their progression and growth with-in their role. As such, if you feel you tick most of the boxes required, with the exception of key a development area, please feel confident in making an application. We’re expecting a strong response for this Senior Android Developer role, and looking to screen candidates immediately ready to shortlist candidates ASAP. As such, please send a CV to matthew.coney@adameher.com or apply within ASAP to be considered.

jobs_results.title: Mid Android Developer
jobs_results.description:
Are you an experienced Mid-Level Android Developer looking to join a collaborative team?
Games Workshop is seeking a talented individual to work on our Warhammer Studio's Book & Boxed Games team, focusing on modern architectures and technologies.
As a Mid-Level Android Developer, you will contribute to the development and growth of our agile software engineering team by working on new and existing mobile native apps that support our Warhammer hobby.
These apps enable customers to build armies, lookup rules, or redeem additional digital content, helping them engage with our physical products such as painting miniatures and Warhammer+.
We're looking for someone who can efficiently deliver quality solutions to business requirements, including working with Scrum, Product, and other delivery functions.
This involves collaborating with other developers and test analysts to develop robust testing processes, facilitating rapid delivery of high-quality software.
To ensure we uphold and raise the quality of team output, we encourage code reviews and feedback. The ideal candidate will have demonstrable experience in native Android applications, strong understanding of Agile/Scrum delivery methods, Unit Testing, Jetpack Compose, Room or other SQL data layers, Kotlin coroutines.
What We Offer
At Games Workshop, we value individuals who put the company's needs first when at work.
In return for your hard work, you will receive 33 days holiday per year (including public holidays), matching contributory pension scheme up to 7.5%, profit share bonus (subject to GW meeting profit targets), and option to join our Share Save scheme. Additionally, you will enjoy a staff discount of between 25% and 50% on our products.
Key Information
Location: This role is home-based, with occasional visits to our UK head office in Lenton, Nottingham.

Salary: £60,000 - £80,000 per annum

jobs_results.title: Junior Android Developer at Moneybox
jobs_results.description: Moneybox is hiring with Peerlist for a Full-time Junior Android Developer. Required skills: Android Jetpack,Kotlin,Java,MVVM,System Design

jobs_results.title: Android Developer
jobs_results.description:
As a trusted partner of some of the UK's leading energy brands, our client is seeking a skilled Android Developer to join their dynamic team. You'll work on cutting-edge mobile applications whilst collaborating with talented professionals to deliver exceptional user experiences.

What you'll do:
• Design and Develop: Design, build and maintain high-performance, reusable, and reliable code.
• Collaborate: Work seamlessly with cross-functional teams to achieve project goals.
• Optimise Performance: Ensure smooth app performance and responsiveness.

What you'll need:
• Strong Android Foundation: Solid understanding of Android SDK, Kotlin, and Java.
• Technical Expertise: Proficiency in RESTful APIs, offline storage, threading, and performance tuning.
• Design Sense: Knowledge of Android UI design principles and Google's Android Design principles.
• Problem-Solving Skills: Ability to tackle complex technical challenges and find creative solutions.
• Passion for Mobile: Enthusiasm for mobile app development and a drive to stay updated.

Offering:
• Competitive Compensation: Attractive salary and benefits package.
• Flexible Work: Work-life balance and hybrid work options.
• Professional Development: Opportunities for training and skill enhancement.
• Supportive Team: Collaborative and friendly work environment.

This is a chance for you to join an innovative company where you will be encouraged to learn new skills, take on challenging projects, and advance your career.

jobs_results.title: Senior Android Developer
jobs_results.description:
Senior Android Developer opportunity:

A consultancy has an opportunity for an experienced Senior Android Developer. The right candidate will have a minimum of 7 years of Java and Kotlin, testing methodologies, along with experience with Android apps featuring maps functionalities.

Our client is based in Tewkesbury, Gloucestershire and requires being in the office 1 day a week.

Skills required:
• Java and Kotlin expertise
• End-to-end development - requirement gathering, testing
• C# experience beneficial
• Map and location application features experience

Additional Requirements:
This candidate will need to have or be able to obtain SC clearance. British citizens or ILR ONLY!

If you meet these qualifications and have relevant work experience that makes you qualified enough to take up this role then please apply now! I'd be keen to discuss with you the opportunity and process!

To find out more about Computer Futures please visit www.computerfutures.com

jobs_results.title: Android Developer - Kraken Field
jobs_results.description:
Kraken is the technology tentacle of the Octopus Energy Group.

We’re looking for a mobile developer to join Octopus’s rapidly expanding home retrofitting tech platform, Kraken Field.

About Kraken Field

We’re making converting homes to green electrons as simple as possible, by building a giant integrated platform to enable engineers to retrofit homes with smart meters, solar panels, heat pumps, and EV chargers.

We’re busy launching in new countries, working with ever more engineers and tech partners, building exciting new features at scale, and creating the integrated solution to retrofit homes across the world - all in the name of making it as easy and cheap as possible for customers to go green.

Kraken Field is a multifunctional team made up of product, backend, design, mobile, web and more - all focused together on making Octopus the go-to name in green home installations. And we’re looking for smart individuals with an interest in the space who can help us make it happen.

Mobile development at Octopus

As well as being part of Kraken Field you’ll be part of a large team of mobile developers across Octopus with projects spanning Electric Vehicles, Energy usage flexibility, Energy accounts, Smart home devices, Acquisitions and Engineer solutions.

All our apps are built with declarative UI frameworks (Jetpack Compose & SwiftUI), all our APIs are built in GraphQL, and we use a modern selection of libraries and software development techniques.We have projects in pure Android/Kotlin, others in pure iOS/Swift and we also use Kotlin Multiplatform in larger projects to share code between native codebases.

—Don’t think you check off the requirements below? We love hiring passionate people with a drive to learn so drop us a speculative application—

About you & what you’ll do
• You’ll be someone who thrives on uncertainty and loves to make an impact.
• You’ll be passionate about what you do and that shows through your enthusiasm and communication.
• Your values will align with that of the company’s, you’ll care about sustainability and creating a better future for our planet.
• You’ll enjoy contributing across the whole development process including design, product management and stay on top of upcoming technologies that could benefit the business.
• The home retrofitting industry and Kraken Field as a product are rapidly expanding, and are a hugely important part of decarbonising the planet - you’ll have big responsibility from day one and really help influence how we scale the technology to make that happen.
You’ll..
• Be able to discuss vision and features within a team and propose creative solutions
• Be proficient with Kotlin and have experimented with other programming languages
• Have a good knowledge of Jetpack Compose having used it in a professional environment
• Be passionate about app architecture and can talk about the benefits and drawbacks of various patterns (MVC, MVVM, Redux)
• Be passionate about great app design and user experience
• Have used GraphQL or are interested in learning
• Have knowledge of reactive libraries, offline storage, API integration, and testing
• Be familiar with source control best practices and continuous integration
• Be excited to explore cross platform code sharing solutions (whilst keeping the UI 100% native)
Non requirements but a bonus if you do have experience in any of these areas!
• Professional use of Kotlin Multiplatform
• Exposure to Compose Multiplatform
• Professional iOS development experience

If this sounds like you then we'd love to hear from you.

Studies have shown that some groups of people, like women, are less likely to apply to a role unless they meet 100% of the job requirements. Whoever you are, if you like one of our jobs, we encourage you to apply as you might just be the candidate we hire. Across Octopus, we're looking for genuinely decent people who are honest and empathetic. Our people are our strongest asset and the unique skills and perspectives people bring to the team are the driving force of our success. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute. Our commitment is to provide equal opportunities, an inclusive work environment, and fairness for everyone.

jobs_results.title: Remote Android Developer
jobs_results.description: Job Title : Android Developer Job Type : Permanent Edinburgh (typically 2 days in the office per week, 3 days from home) Salary: £45,000 - £70,000 (depending on experience) I am working with a client who is looking for an experienced Android Developer to join their team and help build a market-leading mobile app. This is an exciting opportunity to work in a collaborative environment, developing and iterating new features while taking ownership of the Android app’s full development lifecycle. Develop new features for the Android app and take ownership of the development lifecycle, including building, testing, packaging, and deployment. Follow mobile architecture best practices and collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality solutions on time. Implement and maintain automated testing frameworks for unit, end-to-end, and visual regression testing. Participate in agile development processes, including sprint planning, retrospectives, and daily stand-ups. Solid experience in Android development, with a strong focus on Kotlin (Java knowledge is a plus). Proficiency in integrating third-party APIs and working with networking concepts such as RESTful services and JSON/XML. Familiarity with Android SDK, app components, lifecycle management, permissions system, and Jetpack libraries. Experience with mobile UI development, including building responsive designs for various screen sizes and adhering to design systems. Strong understanding of different testing phases for Android applications, including unit testing, end-to-end testing, and performance optimization. Non-contributory pension (8%-12%) ~ Discretionary bonus based on performance ~34 days of annual leave (including bank holidays) ~ Additional benefits include private medical cover, life assurance, critical illness cover, enhanced parental leave, retail discount vouchers, cycle-to-work scheme, and subsidised restaurant and online GP appointments.
